verses.verse: Then answered <WH6030> Eliphaz <WH464> the Temanite <WH8489>, and said <WH559>,
Should a wise man <WH2450> utter <WH6030> vain <WH7307> knowledge <WH1847>, and fill <WH4390> his belly <WH990> with the east wind <WH6921>?
Should he reason <WH3198> with unprofitable <WH5532> talk <WH1697>? or with speeches <WH4405> with which he can do no good <WH3276>?
Yes <WH6565>, you cast off fear <WH3374>, and restrain <WH1639> prayer <WH7881> before <WH6440> God <WH410>.
For your mouth <WH6310> utters <WH502> your iniquity <WH5771>, and you choose <WH977> the tongue <WH3956> of the crafty <WH6175>.
Your own mouth <WH6310> condemns <WH7561> you <WH8193>, and not I: Yes, your own lips testify against you <WH6030>.
Are you the first <WH7223> man <WH120> that was born <WH3205>? or were you made <WH2342> before <WH6440> the hills <WH1389>?
Have you heard <WH8085> the secret <WH5475> of God <WH433>? and do you restrain <WH1639> wisdom to yourself <WH2451>?
What know <WH3045> you <WH3045>, that we know not <WH995>? what understand you, which is not in us?
With us are both the grayheaded <WH7867> and very aged <WH3453> men <WH3524>, much older <WH3117> than your father <WH1>.
Are the consolations <WH8575> of God <WH410> small <WH4592> with you <WH328>? is there any secret thing with you <WH1697>?
Why does your heart <WH3820> carry you away <WH3947>? and what do your eyes <WH5869> wink at <WH7335>,
That you turn <WH7725> your spirit <WH7307> against God <WH410>, and lettest such words <WH4405> go out <WH3318> of your mouth <WH6310>?
What is man <WH582>, that he should be clean <WH2135>? and he which is born <WH3205> of a woman <WH802>, that he should be righteous <WH6663>?
Behold <WH539>, he puts no trust in his saints <WH6918>; Yes <WH8064>, the heavens are not clean <WH2141> in his sight <WH5869>.
How much more abominable <WH8581> and filthy <WH444> is man <WH376>, which drinks <WH8354> iniquity <WH5766> like water <WH4325>?
I will show <WH2331> you <WH8085>, hear me <WH2372>; and that which I have seen I will declare <WH5608>;
Which wise <WH2450> men have told <WH5046> from their fathers <WH1>, and have not hid it <WH3582>:
Unto whom alone the earth <WH776> was given <WH5414>, and no stranger <WH2114> passed <WH5674> among them <WH8432>.
The wicked <WH7563> man travails <WH2342> with pain all his days <WH3117>, and the number <WH4557> of years <WH8141> is hidden <WH6845> to the oppressor <WH6184>.
A dreadful <WH6343> sound <WH6963> is in his ears <WH241>: in prosperity <WH7965> the destroyer <WH7703> shall come upon him <WH935>.
He believes <WH539> not that he shall return <WH7725> out of darkness <WH2822>, and he is waited <WH6822> for of the sword <WH2719>.
He wanders abroad <WH5074> for bread <WH3899>, saying <WH3045>, Where is it? he knows that the day <WH3117> of darkness <WH2822> is ready <WH3559> at his hand <WH3027>.
Trouble <WH6862> and anguish <WH4691> shall make him afraid <WH1204>; they shall prevail <WH8630> against him <WH4428>, as a king ready <WH6264> to the battle <WH3593>.
For he stretches out <WH5186> his hand <WH3027> against God <WH410>, and strengthens <WH1396> himself against the Almighty <WH7706>.
He runs <WH7323> upon him <WH6677>, even on his neck, upon the thick <WH5672> bosses <WH1354> of his bucklers <WH4043>:
Because he covers <WH3680> his face <WH6440> with his fatness <WH2459>, and makes <WH6213> collops of fat <WH6371> on his flanks <WH3689>.
And he dwells <WH7931> in desolate <WH3582> cities <WH5892>, and in houses <WH1004> which no man inhabits <WH3427>, which are ready <WH6257> to become heaps <WH1530>.
He shall not be rich <WH6238>, neither shall his substance <WH2428> continue <WH6965>, neither shall he prolong <WH5186> the perfection <WH4512> there upon the earth <WH776>.
He shall not depart <WH5493> out of darkness <WH2822>; the flame <WH7957> shall dry up <WH3001> his branches <WH3127>, and by the breath <WH7307> of his mouth <WH6310> shall he go away <WH5493>.
Let not him that is deceived <WH8582> trust <WH539> in vanity <WH7723>: for vanity <WH7723> shall be his recompence <WH8545>.
It shall be accomplished <WH4390> before <WH3808> his time <WH3117>, and his branch <WH3712> shall not be green <WH7488>.
He shall shake off <WH2554> his unripe grape <WH1154> as the vine <WH1612>, and shall cast off <WH7993> his flower <WH5328> as the olive <WH2132>.
For the congregation <WH5712> of hypocrites <WH2611> shall be desolate <WH1565>, and fire <WH784> shall consume <WH398> the tabernacles <WH168> of bribery <WH7810>.
They conceive <WH2029> mischief <WH5999>, and bring forth <WH3205> vanity <WH205>, and their belly <WH990> prepares <WH3559> deceit <WH4820>.
